page.title: 09COTSWOLD PARK,N.CERNEY
page.content: Cotswold House ,later called Park, was built about 1795.The original house had 3 storeys and a rear service wing of 2 storeys.An extension was added later .The valley overlooked by the house became an ornamental park before 1825 .The estate is not used by the owners but has been rented out over a long period as a weekend retreat for another family.In the past this house has been used as a Convalescent Home for POW's during the 1939-45 War.Vegetables from the walled garden were very valuable during this time.Now the house conssists of 9 bedrooms,6 bathrooms, dining room, sitting room,drawing room, breakfast room,flower room,playroom and kitchen. Outside 6 lawns cover 3 acres of land. There are many outbuildings, including an area for breeding pheasants,a swimming pool and a tennis court.
